featured.text: Moreover, pieces of junk may collide with each other and break into fragments which fall back to the Earth.

The junk varies from tiny pieces of paint chipped off rockets to cameras, huge fuel tanks, and even odd items like the million-dollar tool kit that astronaut Heidemarie Stefanyshyn-Piper lost during a spacewalk.
The first piece of space junk was created in 1964, when the American satellite Vanguard I stopped operating and lost its connection with the ground center.
Which of the following statements is true about space junk?

definition.en_def: Something that is considered worthless or of little value.
definition.example: He decided to throw away the junk that had been piling up in the garage.
